title: Authors and Citation
text: Schoch D (2024). dialrs: Parse phone numbers. R package version 0.0.1.9000, https://schochastics.github.io/dialrs/, https://github.com/schochastics/dialrs.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dialrs: Parse phone numbers},   author = {David Schoch},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1.9000, https://schochastics.github.io/dialrs/},   url = {https://github.com/schochastics/dialrs}, }

title: Parse phone numbers
text: dialrs experimental R package parse phone numbers using Rust crate phonenumber.

title: Parse phone numbers
text: can install development version dialrs like :

title: Parse phone numbers
code: library(dialrs) numbers <- c("+1 202-555-0173", "+33 122 334 455", "+1 1 800 FLOWERS") phone_is_valid(numbers) #> [1]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE phone_type(numbers) #> [1] "fixed_line_or_mobile" "fixed_line"           "unknown" phone_country_code(numbers) #> [1]  1 33  1 phone_parse(numbers, format = "International") #> [1] "+1 202-555-0173"   "+33 1 22 33 44 55" "+1 18003569377" phone_parse(numbers, format = "National") #> [1] "(202) 555-0173" "01 22 33 44 55" "18003569377" phone_parse(numbers, format = "RFC3966") #> [1] "tel:+1-202-555-0173"   "tel:+33-1-22-33-44-55" "tel:+1-18003569377" phone_parse(numbers, format = "E.164") #> [1] "+12025550173"  "+33122334455"  "+118003569377"

title: Parse phone numbers
text: already R package , called dialr, wraps Google’s libphonenumber Java library.

title: dialrs: Parse phone numbers — dialrs-package
text: Parse phone numbers using Rust crate 'phonenumber'. Includes validation numbers formatting.

title: dialrs: Parse phone numbers — dialrs-package
text: Maintainer: David Schoch david@schochastics.net (ORCID)

title: Check if strings are valid phone numbers — phone_is_valid
text: TRUE valid phone number, FALSE otherwise

title: Check if strings are valid phone numbers — phone_is_valid
code: phone_is_valid(fake_phone) #>   [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [13] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [25] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE #>  [37] FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [49]  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [61]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [73]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [85]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE #>  [97]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE

text: Parse phone numbers specific format

title: Parse phone numbers into specific format — phone_parse
Parse phone numbers into specific format — phone_parse
text: phone character vector phone numbers country CLDR country code. empty, tries parse phone format character. one "International", "National", "RFC3966", "E.164"

title: Parse phone numbers into specific format — phone_parse
text: character vector parsed formatted phone numbers phone_parse(fake_phone,format = "RFC3966") phone_parse("016012345678",country = "DE",format = "International")
